description: An island made up of wrecked remains of hundreds of abandoned ships, connected to Water 7 by a large stone bridge. This is where Franky built his Battle Franky contraptions and where Tom's Workers often constructed their ships.

keyEvents.title: Young Franky Found on Scrap Island
keyEvents.description: Tom discovers 10-year-old Cutty Flam on Scrap Island firing cannonballs from his Battle Franky contraption after being abandoned by his pirate parents.
keyEvents.significance: This is where Franky's story with Tom begins, marking the location where the legendary shipwright found his future apprentice.

keyEvents.title: Sea Train Construction Site
keyEvents.description: Scrap Island serves as the primary construction site for the Sea Train project, where Tom, Franky, and Iceburg work for ten years to build the Puffing Tom.
keyEvents.significance: The island becomes the birthplace of one of the most revolutionary inventions in the One Piece world.

statusHistory.reason: Island remains operational as a shipbuilding location

name.japanese: トムズ ワーカーズ

description: The shipbuilding company founded and run by the legendary shipwright Tom. Located on Scrap Island near Water 7, it served as the home and workplace for Tom and his apprentices Franky and Iceburg during the construction of the Sea Train.

keyEvents.title: Tom's Workers Introduced
keyEvents.description: Tom's Workers is shown as the shipbuilding company where Tom trains Franky and Iceburg, with Kokoro and Yokozuna as part of the family.
keyEvents.significance: Establishes the workplace and home where some of the most important ships in One Piece history were built, including the Oro Jackson and the Sea Train.

keyEvents.title: Sea Train Construction Headquarters
keyEvents.description: Tom's Workers serves as the headquarters for the decade-long Sea Train construction project.
keyEvents.significance: The company becomes the birthplace of the revolutionary Sea Train technology.

statusHistory.reason: Tom's Workers operates during the Sea Train construction
